ingredients.name: Vegetables (such as onions, potatoes, spinach, cauliflower)

steps: In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, rice flour, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, garam masala, baking soda, and salt. Mix well.
Gradually add water to the dry ingredients to make a smooth batter of pouring consistency.
Add the chopped vegetables to the batter and mix until they are evenly coated.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.
Drop spoonfuls of the vegetable-batter mixture into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy, turning occasionally.
Once the pakauda turns golden brown and crispy, remove them from the oil using a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve hot pakauda with chutney or sauce of your choice. Enjoy!
